title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.13 - Fees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.13 - Fees

State Regulations

Article 21-A provides a statutory fee of $75 for the
issuance of a restricted license and also for the establishment of a schedule
of fees to be paid by or on behalf of a participant in a driver rehabilitation
program, which fee shall defray the ongoing expenses of the program. (a) Statutory $75 license fee. The statutory fee of $75 for the issuance of a restricted
license must be paid to the Department of Motor Vehicles before a restricted
license will be issued. The fee for the renewal of a restricted license will be
the same fee which would be required for the renewal of the person's driver's
license, and if such fee is paid, such fee will be made applicable to the
driver's license which is issued to such person at the completion of the
suspension period or upon approval of the issuance of a driver's license after
the revocation period provided that the revokee has satisfactorily complied
with all the requirements applicable to the issuance and use of the restricted
license. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
135.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
